\subsection{Null tests and empirical p-values}
We quantify whether the anchored lattice fit quality could arise under simple null ensembles.
The test statistic is the mean per-particle log-base-$\varphi$ error $\bar\epsilon$.

\paragraph{Observed anchored scan.}
\begin{align}
\bar\epsilon_\mathrm{obs} &= 6.940320e-02.
\end{align}

\begin{center}
\begin{tabular}{lcc}
\hline
Particle & $\epsilon$ & best $q$\\
\hline
electron & 0.000000e+00 & 0\\
muon & 7.952564e-02 & 44\\
tau & 5.529840e-02 & 68\\
W & 1.161719e-01 & 99\\
Z & 1.216442e-01 & 101\\
top & 4.377904e-02 & 106\\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\end{center}

\paragraph{Null A (log-uniform i.i.d.).}
\begin{align}
\mathrm{min}=9.578179e-03,\;\mathrm{med}=5.243682e-02,\;\mathrm{max}=9.297421e-02,\;p_\mathrm{emp}=0.883000.
\end{align}
